enemy_1007_slime.name: Originium Slug
enemy_1007_slime.description: An infected wild creature. Due to their low intelligence, they are easily controlled by enemy casters for use as cannon fodder during invasions.

enemy_1007_slime_2.name: Originium Slug α
enemy_1007_slime_2.description: An infected wild creature that is more dangerous than a normal Originium Slug. Due to their low intelligence, they are easily controlled by enemy casters for use as cannon fodder during invasions.

enemy_1007_slime_3.name: Originium Slug β
enemy_1007_slime_3.description: An infected wild creature that is more dangerous than an Originium Slug α. Due to their low intelligence, they are easily controlled by enemy casters for use as cannon fodder during invasions.

enemy_1004_mslime.name: Acid Originium Slug
enemy_1004_mslime.description: An infected wild creature that can secrete corrosive fluids strong enough to dissolve armor. Due to their low intelligence, they are easily controlled by enemy casters for use as cannon fodder during invasions.
enemy_1004_mslime.ability: Every attack reduces the enemy's DEF

enemy_1004_mslime_2.name: Acid Originium Slug α
enemy_1004_mslime_2.description: An infected wild creature that is more dangerous than an Acid Originium Slug. Secretes corrosive fluids strong enough to dissolve armor. Due to their low intelligence, they are easily controlled by enemy casters for use as cannon fodder during invasions.
enemy_1004_mslime_2.ability: Every attack reduces the enemy's DEF

enemy_1021_bslime.name: Infused Originium Slug
enemy_1021_bslime.description: An infected wild creature that has become unstable due to assimilating a large amount of Originium into its abdomen, exploding upon death. Due to their low intelligence, they are easily controlled by enemy casters for use as cannon fodder during invasions.
enemy_1021_bslime.ability: Upon death, deals large physical damage in an area.

enemy_1021_bslime_2.name: Infused Originium Slug α
enemy_1021_bslime_2.description: An infected wild creature that has become unstable due to assimilating a large amount of Originium into its abdomen, exploding upon death. More dangerous than a normal Infused Originium Slug. Due to their low intelligence, they are easily controlled by enemy casters for use as cannon fodder during invasions.
enemy_1021_bslime_2.ability: Upon death, deals large physical damage in an area.

enemy_1000_gopro.name: Hound
enemy_1000_gopro.description: A creature controlled by a Reunion recon squad. Monitoring equipment is strapped to its body. Due to their speed and evasiveness, they can easily slip through enemy defenses and cause heavy damage.

enemy_1000_gopro_2.name: Hound Pro
enemy_1000_gopro_2.description: A creature controlled by a Reunion recon squad that is more dangerous than a normal Hound. Monitoring equipment is strapped to its body. Due to their speed and evasiveness, they can easily slip through enemy defenses and cause heavy damage.

enemy_1000_gopro_3.name: Rabid Hound Pro
enemy_1000_gopro_3.description: A creature controlled by a Reunion recon squad that is more dangerous than a Hound Pro. Monitoring equipment is strapped to its body. Due to their speed and evasiveness, they can easily slip through enemy defenses and cause heavy damage.

enemy_1002_nsabr.name: Soldier
enemy_1002_nsabr.description: One of Reunion's basic melee soldiers. Equipped with illegally obtained weapons and armor, they wear masks to conceal their identities during operations.

enemy_1003_ncbow.name: Crossbowman
enemy_1003_ncbow.description: One of Reunion's basic ranged soldiers. Equipped with illegally obtained weapons and armor, they wear masks to conceal their identities during operations.

enemy_1003_ncbow_2.name: Crossbowman Leader
enemy_1003_ncbow_2.description: One of Reunion's senior ranged soldiers, more powerful than a normal Crossbowman. Equipped with illegally obtained weapons and armor, they wear masks to conceal their identities during operations.

enemy_1011_wizard.name: Caster
enemy_1011_wizard.description: One of Reunion's basic casters. These Infected casters tend to use their own Originium to power their Arts. Because they don't rely on staves, their attacks are more unpredictable and they cannot simply be disarmed.

enemy_1011_wizard_2.name: Caster Leader
enemy_1011_wizard_2.description: One of Reunion's senior Casters, more powerful than a normal Caster. These Infected casters tend to use their own Originium to power their Arts. Because they don't rely on staves, their attacks are more unpredictable and they cannot simply be disarmed.

enemy_1018_aoemag.name: Senior Caster
enemy_1018_aoemag.description: One of Reunion's elite Casters. They use complex Area-of-Effect Arts, making them more potent than normal Casters. Proceed with caution.
enemy_1018_aoemag.ability: Deals area damage to Operators on the four cardinal tiles next to the primary target.

enemy_1018_aoemag_2.name: Senior Caster Leader
enemy_1018_aoemag_2.description: One of Reunion's elite Casters, more dangerous than a normal Caster Leader. They use complex Area-of-Effect Arts, making them more potent than normal Casters. Proceed with caution.
enemy_1018_aoemag_2.ability: Deals area damage to Operators on the four cardinal tiles next to the primary target.

enemy_1013_airdrp.name: Airborne Soldier
enemy_1013_airdrp.description: One of Reunion's special melee soldiers. They are equipped with modified disposable jetpacks made from looted parts. Despite their fairly rudimentary equipment, Reunion uses them to great effect when attacking insufficiently protected areas.
enemy_1013_airdrp.ability: Able to land directly onto the battlefield.

enemy_1013_airdrp_2.name: Airborne Soldier Leader
enemy_1013_airdrp_2.description: One of Reunion's special melee soldiers, more dangerous than a normal Airborne Soldier. They are equipped with modified disposable jetpacks made from looted parts. Despite their fairly rudimentary equipment, Reunion uses them to great effect when attacking insufficiently protected areas.
enemy_1013_airdrp_2.ability: Able to land directly onto the battlefield.

enemy_1024_mortar.name: Mortar Gunner
enemy_1024_mortar.description: One of Reunion's special ranged soldiers. Equipped with pilfered military-grade Originium launchers, they launch explosive attacks from hard-to-defend positions, making them a significant threat to back-line Operators.
enemy_1024_mortar.ability: Very long ranged-attack; deals area damage to Operators on all eight tiles next to the primary target.

enemy_1024_mortar_2.name: Mortar Gunner Leader
enemy_1024_mortar_2.description: One of Reunion's special ranged soldiers, more dangerous than a normal Mortar Gunner. Equipped with pilfered military-grade Originium launchers, they launch explosive attacks from hard-to-defend positions, making them a significant threat to back-line Operators.
enemy_1024_mortar_2.ability: Very long ranged-attack; deals area damage to Operators on all eight tiles next to the primary target.

enemy_1014_rogue.name: Dual Swordsman
enemy_1014_rogue.description: One of Reunion's melee soldiers. Trained in dual-wielding, it is likely that these fighters once served in the military. Their combat expertise makes them harder to deal with than the average rioter.

enemy_1014_rogue_2.name: Dual Swordsman Leader
enemy_1014_rogue_2.description: One of Reunion's melee soldiers, more dangerous than a normal Dual-bladed Swordsman. Trained in dual-wielding, it is likely that these fighters once served in the military. Their combat expertise makes them harder to deal with than the average rioter.

enemy_1015_litamr.name: Light-Armored Soldier
enemy_1015_litamr.description: One of Reunion's melee soldiers. Equipped with illegally obtained weapons and armor, they are better equipped and trained, and cannot be taken down with conventional strategies.

enemy_1015_litamr_2.name: Light-Armored Soldier Leader
enemy_1015_litamr_2.description: One of Reunion's melee soldiers, more dangerous than a normal Armored Soldier. Equipped with illegally obtained weapons and armor, they are better equipped and trained, and cannot be taken down with conventional strategies.

enemy_1006_shield.name: Heavy Defender
enemy_1006_shield.description: One of Reunion's melee soldiers. Equipped with a full set of heavy armor, they have ample combat experience and are extremely hard to defeat. As they may have had formal training, proceed with caution.

enemy_1006_shield_2.name: Heavy Defender Leader
enemy_1006_shield_2.description: One of Reunion's melee soldiers, more dangerous than a normal Heavy Defender. Equipped with a full set of heavy armor, they have ample combat experience and are extremely hard to defeat. As they may have had formal training, proceed with caution.

enemy_1006_shield_3.name: Heavy Defender Lieutenant
enemy_1006_shield_3.description: One of Reunion's melee soldiers, more dangerous than a Heavy Defender Leader. Equipped with a full set of heavy armor, they usually appear alongside a large number of troops and are extremely hard to defeat. Proceed with caution.

enemy_1001_bigbo.name: Big Bob
enemy_1001_bigbo.description: One of Reunion's squad leaders. He wears a heavy blast suit and attacks with an electric chainsaw. He has been spotted leading peripheral operations in some remote areas, and is known to be a seasoned combatant and commander. Due to his devastating attacks and extreme survivability, proceed with utmost caution.

enemy_1001_bigbo_2.name: Big Adam
enemy_1001_bigbo_2.description: One of Reunion's squad leaders. He wears a heavy blast suit and attacks with an electric chainsaw. Bears a remarkable similarity to Big Bob, but does not appear to be the same person. It is unknown whether there is any relationship between the two of them. Data suggests that he may be even more dangerous than Big Bob. Due to his devastating attacks and extreme survivability, proceed with utmost caution.

enemy_1016_diaman.name: Metal Crab
enemy_1016_diaman.description: An infected wild creature, completely covered in metal. Though most conventional weapons are not very effective against them, they aren't as heavy as they seem, and also move slowly. Due to their low intelligence, they are easily controlled by enemy casters for use as cannon fodder during invasions.

enemy_1009_lurker.name: Lurker
enemy_1009_lurker.description: One of Reunion's special soldiers. They move swiftly and stealthily, making it almost impossible to detect them before they engage in combat. Therefore, teamwork is needed in order to defeat them.

enemy_1008_ghost.name: Wraith
enemy_1008_ghost.description: One of Reunion's engineers. Though unarmed, they utilize their agility and cunning to slip through defenses in order to sabotage mechanical and electrical equipment.

enemy_1005_yokai.name: Monster
enemy_1005_yokai.description: An unmanned enemy drone, called 'Monster' by Reunion forces. Equipped with a long-range Arts receiver, they are likely operated by concealed Casters. Though unlikely to cause heavy damage to armored Operators, they can still pose a considerable threat.

enemy_1005_yokai_2.name: Monster Mk II
enemy_1005_yokai_2.description: An unmanned enemy drone that has been upgraded from its namesake model, the Monster MkII. Equipped with a small gun and a long-range Arts receiver, they are likely operated by concealed Casters. Though unlikely to cause heavy damage to armored Operators, they can still pose a considerable threat.

enemy_1005_yokai_3.name: Raptor
enemy_1005_yokai_3.description: An unmanned enemy drone, its design and name seem to be inspired by a certain space game. Equipped with a minigun and a long-range Arts receiver, they are likely operated by concealed Casters. Their outstanding stealthiness and attack power pose a major threat to Operators.

enemy_1017_defdrn.name: Defender-4
enemy_1017_defdrn.description: An unmanned enemy drone known as the Defender-4. Though they do not have any offensive capabilities, they must be taken care of due to their ability to support enemy troops.
enemy_1017_defdrn.ability: Flying unit; increases the DEF of nearby enemy units.

enemy_1019_jshoot.name: Invisible Crossbowman
enemy_1019_jshoot.description: One of Reunion's ranged soldiers. The ghillie suit they wear makes it almost impossible to detect them before they engage in combat. Therefore, teamwork is needed to defeat them.

enemy_1019_jshoot_2.name: Invisible Crossbowman Leader
enemy_1019_jshoot_2.description: One of Reunion's ranged soldiers, more dangerous than a normal Invisible Crossbowman. The ghillie suit they wear makes it almost impossible to detect them before they engage in combat. Therefore, teamwork is needed to defeat them.

enemy_1023_jmage.name: Invisible Caster
enemy_1023_jmage.description: One of Reunion's Casters. The ghillie suit they wear makes it almost impossible to detect them before they engage in combat. Therefore, teamwork is needed to defeat them.

enemy_1023_jmage_2.name: Invisible Caster Leader
enemy_1023_jmage_2.description: One of Reunion's Casters, more dangerous than a normal Invisible Caster. The ghillie suit they wear makes it almost impossible to detect them before they engage in combat. Therefore, teamwork is needed to defeat them.

enemy_1020_obsv.name: Technical Scout
enemy_1020_obsv.description: One of Reunion's engineers. They are able to utilize devices to assess the status of Operators and their equipment. Prioritize dealing with them.
enemy_1020_obsv.ability: Reveals <$ba.invisible>invisible</> allied units in its surroundings

enemy_1010_demon.name: Sarkaz Greatswordsman
enemy_1010_demon.description: A mercenary from Sarkaz. The Originium inside them has boosted their physical abilities, allowing them to wield larger weapons with ease and withstand more damage.

enemy_1010_demon_2.name: Sarkaz Greatswordsman Leader
enemy_1010_demon_2.description: A mercenary from Sarkaz, more dangerous than a normal Sarkaz Swordsman. The Originium inside them has boosted their physical abilities, allowing them to wield larger weapons with ease and withstand more damage.

enemy_1012_dcross.name: Sarkaz Crossbowman
enemy_1012_dcross.description: A mercenary from Sarkaz. Their towering physique has not hampered their marksmanship. On the contrary, it allows them to use larger ranged weapons with ease and withstand more damage.

enemy_1012_dcross_2.name: Sarkaz Crossbowman Leader
enemy_1012_dcross_2.description: A mercenary from Sarkaz, more dangerous than a normal Sarkaz Sniper. Their towering physique has not hampered their marksmanship. On the contrary, it allows them to use larger ranged weapons with ease and withstand more damage.

enemy_1022_dmage.name: Sarkaz Caster
enemy_1022_dmage.description: A mercenary from Sarkaz. They use complex Arts to attack. Proceed with caution.
enemy_1022_dmage.ability: Uses chains to paralyze allied Operators.

enemy_1022_dmage_2.name: Sarkaz Caster Leader
enemy_1022_dmage_2.description: A mercenary from Sarkaz, more dangerous than a normal Sarkaz Caster. They use complex Arts to attack. Proceed with caution.
enemy_1022_dmage_2.ability: Uses chains to paralyze allied Operators.

enemy_1501_demonk.name: Sarkaz Centurion
enemy_1501_demonk.description: One of Reunion's squad leaders who also serves as a Sarkaz mercenary. He leads a group of Sarkaz mercenaries to fight on the front lines. Based upon the limited intel available, he is extremely tight-lipped, thus making it unlikely to get any information from him.

enemy_1025_reveng.name: Avenger
enemy_1025_reveng.description: An unidentified combatant who attacks using unconventional methods. Equipped with a special weapon, they are known to change their attack patterns during combat, making them difficult to defend against.
enemy_1025_reveng.ability: Increases ATK and AS significantly when HP is under 50%.

enemy_1025_reveng_2.name: Hateful Avenger
enemy_1025_reveng_2.description: An unidentified combatant who attacks using unconventional methods, more dangerous than a normal Avenger. Equipped with a special weapon, they are known to change their attack patterns during combat, making them difficult to defend against. Proceed with caution.
enemy_1025_reveng_2.ability: Increases ATK and AS significantly when HP is under 50%.

enemy_1026_aghost.name: Wraith Leader
enemy_1026_aghost.description: One of Reunion's engineers. Due to being better trained and more heavily equipped, they are harder to neutralize in time, even if they have been detected. They utilize their agility and cunning to slip through defenses in order to sabotage mechanical and electrical equipment.

enemy_1027_mob.name: Rioter
enemy_1027_mob.description: An enemy combatant of unknown identity. They are often found wherever there is turmoil and unrest. They wear a face mask to conceal their identity and use haphazardly-made weapons to engage in melee combat.

enemy_1027_mob_2.name: Rioter Leader
enemy_1027_mob_2.description: An enemy combatant of unknown identity, more dangerous than a normal Thug. They are often found wherever there is turmoil and unrest. They wear a face mask to conceal their identity and use haphazardly-made weapons to engage in melee combat. These weapons are usually associated with riots.

enemy_1028_mocock.name: Cocktail Thrower
enemy_1028_mocock.description: An enemy combatant of unknown identity. They wear a face mask to conceal their identity, and use Molotov cocktails to deal damage within a range. These weapons are usually associated with riots.

enemy_1028_mocock_2.name: Firebomb Thrower
enemy_1028_mocock_2.description: An enemy combatant of unknown identity, more dangerous than a normal Cocktail Thrower. They wear a face mask to conceal their identity, and use Molotov cocktails to deal damage within a range.

enemy_1029_shdsbr.name: Shielded Soldier
enemy_1029_shdsbr.description: One of Reunion's melee soldiers. Equipped with illegally obtained weapons and armor, they additionally bear a shield. They are slightly harder to take down than a regular Reunion foot soldier.

enemy_1029_shdsbr_2.name: Shielded Soldier Leader
enemy_1029_shdsbr_2.description: One of Reunion's melee soldiers, more dangerous than a normal Shielded Soldier. Equipped with illegally obtained weapons and armor, they additionally bear a shield. They are slightly harder to take down than a regular Reunion foot soldier.

enemy_1030_wteeth.name: Junkman
enemy_1030_wteeth.description: A ragged-looking enemy combatant. According to intel, they disguise themselves as drifters to conceal the fact that they are mercenaries. Though their background is unknown, their fierce attacks require them to be dealt with cautiously.

enemy_1030_wteeth_2.name: Veteran Junkman
enemy_1030_wteeth_2.description: A ragged-looking enemy combatant with scars across their body, likely boasting more combat experience than a normal Junkman. According to intel, they disguise themselves as drifters to conceal the fact that they are mercenaries. Though their background is unknown, their fierce attacks require them to be dealt with cautiously.

enemy_1031_mrogue.name: Arts Guard
enemy_1031_mrogue.description: One of Reunion's melee soldiers who has also been trained in using Originium Arts. They are able to enhance their melee attacks with armor-ignoring Arts damage. Reunion's frontline squads have become a lot more devastating since the inclusion of these soldiers.

enemy_1031_mrogue_2.name: Arts Guard Leader
enemy_1031_mrogue_2.description: One of Reunion's melee soldiers who also has been trained in using Originium Arts, more dangerous than a normal Arts Guard. They are able to enhance their melee attacks with armor-ignoring Arts damage. Reunion's frontline squads have become a lot more devastating since the inclusion of these soldiers.

enemy_1032_katar.name: Bladed Fighter
enemy_1032_katar.description: One of Reunion's melee soldiers who has been trained in traditional martial arts. Equipped with refitted fist weapons, they are capable of inflicting massive damage with their rapid strikes.

enemy_1032_katar_2.name: Bladed Fighter Leader
enemy_1032_katar_2.description: One of Reunion's melee soldiers who has been trained in traditional martial arts and is more dangerous than a normal Bladed Fighter. Equipped with refitted fist weapons, they are capable of inflicting massive damage with their rapid strikes.

enemy_1033_handax.name: Logger
enemy_1033_handax.description: An enemy of unknown identity who wears logging equipment and attacks with lumbering tools. Because of their attire, weapon, and machine-like behavior, they are often called 'Log Splitters.'

enemy_1033_handax_2.name: Veteran Logger
enemy_1033_handax_2.description: An enemy of unknown identity who wears logging equipment and attacks with lumbering tools. They dye their clothes red to make it easier to identify them, but are also harder to deal with. Their nickname is a bit more human-sounding than 'Log Splitter,' but humans are more terrifying than any machine.

enemy_1034_laxe.name: Butcher
enemy_1034_laxe.description: An enemy of unknown identity who wears white industrial overalls and attacks with a massive blunt object. Their appearances and combat style readily reminds people of those serial killers from movies, hence their nickname - Butcher.

enemy_1034_laxe_2.name: Veteran Butcher
enemy_1034_laxe_2.description: An enemy of unknown identity who wears white industrial overalls and attacks with a massive blunt object. Their hoods have been dyed red to symbolize greater strength and power compared to the rest of their ranks. It is only fitting that their nickname also reflects this.

enemy_1035_haxe.name: Armed Militant
enemy_1035_haxe.description: An enemy of unknown identity. Equipped with a complex array of armor, a gas mask, and tanks of unidentifiable substances, they attack using giant blunt instruments. Due to their logic-defying equipment, they are simply called 'Armed Militants.' Though their movement is slow, even a single swing of their weapon is sure to inflict massive damage. Proceed with caution.

enemy_1035_haxe_2.name: Senior Armed Militant
enemy_1035_haxe_2.description: An enemy of unknown identity. Equipped with a complex array of armor, a gas mask, and tanks of unidentifiable substances, they attack using giant blunt instruments. Based on their equipment, they are even more dangerous than a normal Armed Militant. Though their movement is slow, even a single swing of their weapon is sure to inflict massive damage. Proceed with caution.

enemy_1036_amraoe.name: Shielded Senior Caster
enemy_1036_amraoe.description: One of Reunion's elite Casters. They use complex Area-of-Effect Arts, making them more potent than normal Casters. They also seem to have fortified their defenses with Arts. and must be handled with caution. Due to their special state, they may be more vulnerable to Arts damage.
enemy_1036_amraoe.ability: Deals area damage to Operators on the four cardinal tiles next to the primary target.

enemy_1037_lunsbr.name: Spec Ops Soldier
enemy_1037_lunsbr.description: One of Reunion's melee soldiers. Their equipment differs slightly from that of other soldiers.

enemy_1038_lunmag.name: Spec Ops Caster
enemy_1038_lunmag.description: One of Reunion's Casters. Their armor makes them more resistant to physical damage compared to regular Casters.

enemy_1038_lunmag_2.name: Spec Ops Caster Leader
enemy_1038_lunmag_2.description: One of Reunion's elite Casters. Their armor makes them more resistant to physical damage compared to regular Casters. They have mastered Arts that allows them to attack two targets at once. Proceed with caution.

enemy_1039_breakr.name: Breaker
enemy_1039_breakr.description: A well-trained enemy unit that spearheads assaults. Though their attack power is only slightly higher than average, their terrifying speed often allows them to break through the defenses of the unprepared- hence their nickname, 'Breakers.'

enemy_1039_breakr_2.name: Breaker Leader
enemy_1039_breakr_2.description: A well-trained enemy unit that spearheads assaults, and is harder to defeat than a normal Breaker. Their attack power is higher than average, and their movement speed is incredibly high.

enemy_1040_bombd.name: Bombtail
enemy_1040_bombd.description: An unmanned enemy drone that flies slowly. They carry an explosive warhead that is launched when approaching nearby Operators, inflicting physical damage in an area. Their design seems to have been inspired by a fantasy creature. Though they cannot attack anymore after launching the warhead, their movement speed increases afterwards due to the loss of weight.
enemy_1040_bombd.ability: Can launch a warhead to deal AoE physical damage; movement speed increases after launching the warhead.

enemy_1040_bombd_2.name: Bombtail-G
enemy_1040_bombd_2.description: An unmanned enemy drone that flies slowly. They carry a large explosive warhead that is launched when approaching nearby Operators, inflicting physical damage in an area. Their design seems to have been inspired by a fantasy creature. Though they cannot attack anymore after launching the warhead, their movement speed increases afterwards due to the loss of weight.
enemy_1040_bombd_2.ability: Can launch a warhead to deal AoE physical damage; movement speed increases after launching the warhead.

enemy_1041_lazerd.name: Arts Master A1
enemy_1041_lazerd.description: An unmanned enemy drone with extremely high movement speed, modified from the product of an Arts Education competition. It is equipped with an Arts Weapon module that allows it to launch long-range Arts attacks, so proceed with caution. Based on available data, its weapon module also allows it to block some Arts damage.

enemy_1041_lazerd_2.name: Arts Master A2
enemy_1041_lazerd_2.description: An unmanned enemy drone that had some of its Flight Support modules swapped out, trading speed for a more powerful Arts Weapon module. Capable of using long-range Arts attacks. Proceed with caution. Based on available data, its weapon module also allows it to block some Arts damage.

enemy_1042_frostd.name: Frost
enemy_1042_frostd.description: An unmanned enemy drone equipped with heavy armor to make it harder to destroy. Its prototype was designed by a graphics engine studio. They are equipped with a special device that allows them to drastically reduce the temperature around them, greatly decreasing the attack speed of nearby Operators.
enemy_1042_frostd.ability: Significantly decreases the AS of nearby allied Operators.

enemy_1043_zomsbr.name: Possessed Soldier
enemy_1043_zomsbr.description: A soldier that has been controlled by an unknown entity, capable of regenerating rapidly. The appearance of such an aberration on the battlefield is almost beyond imagination.

enemy_1043_zomsbr_2.name: Possessed Soldier Leader
enemy_1043_zomsbr_2.description: A soldier that has been controlled by an unknown entity, capable of regenerating rapidly and more dangerous than a normal Possessed Soldier. The appearance of such an aberration on the battlefield is almost beyond imagination.

enemy_1044_zomstr.name: Possessed Junkman
enemy_1044_zomstr.description: A Junkman that has been controlled by an unknown entity, capable of regenerating rapidly. Covered with clusters of Originium. The appearance of such an aberration on the battlefield is almost beyond imagination.

enemy_1044_zomstr_2.name: Possessed Veteran Junkman
enemy_1044_zomstr_2.description: A Veteran Junkman that has been controlled by an unknown entity, capable of regenerating rapidly. Covered with clusters of Originium. The appearance of such an aberration on the battlefield is almost beyond imagination.

enemy_1045_hammer.name: Defense Crusher
enemy_1045_hammer.description: One of Reunion's senior elites, clad in a heavy blast suit. Each swing from their weapon is slow but packs tremendous destructive power. Operators will be stunned after taking several attacks.Proceed with caution.
enemy_1045_hammer.ability: After two attacks, the next attack <$ba.stun>Stuns</> its target

enemy_1045_hammer_2.name: Defense Crusher Leader
enemy_1045_hammer_2.description: One of Reunion's senior elites, clad in a heavy blast suit and more dangerous than a normal Defense Crusher. Each swing from their weapon is slow but packs tremendous destructive power. Operators will be stunned after taking several attacks.Proceed with caution.
enemy_1045_hammer_2.ability: After two attacks, the next attack <$ba.stun>Stuns</> its target

enemy_1046_agent.name: Infantry
enemy_1046_agent.description: A basic melee soldier. Their armor provides some defense against Arts damage.

enemy_1046_agent_2.name: Infantry Leader
enemy_1046_agent_2.description: A basic melee soldier. They are stronger than normal Infantry.

enemy_1047_sagent.name: Sniper
enemy_1047_sagent.description: A basic ranged soldier. They have very long range. Their sniper rifles can launch special ammunition capable of stunning our Operators.
enemy_1047_sagent.ability: After two attacks, the next attack <$ba.stun>Stuns</> its target

enemy_1047_sagent_2.name: Sniper Leader
enemy_1047_sagent_2.description: A basic ranged soldier. They are stronger than normal Snipers, firing improved ammunition that stuns for a longer duration. Proceed with caution.
enemy_1047_sagent_2.ability: After two attacks, the next attack <$ba.stun>Stuns</> its target

enemy_1048_hirman.name: Rockbreaker
enemy_1048_hirman.description: A melee soldier. They use standard-issue tactical axes to inflict heavy damage to their targets. When they are blocked by allied Operators, their armor provides improved Arts resistance.

enemy_1048_hirman_2.name: Rockbreaker Leader
enemy_1048_hirman_2.description: A melee soldier. They are more dangerous than normal Rockbreakers, They use standard-issue tactical axes to inflict heavy damage to their targets. Proceed with caution.
enemy_1048_hirman_2.ability: Gains greatly increased RES when blocked

enemy_1049_eagent.name: Agent
enemy_1049_eagent.description: A caster who utilizes coordinated tactics. They are able to enhance their melee attacks with Arts damage, and employ a variety of techniques to break through unprepared defenders.
enemy_1049_eagent.ability: Temporarily reduces the maximum Block of targets attacked by this unit

enemy_1049_eagent_2.name: Agent Leader
enemy_1049_eagent_2.description: A caster who utilizes coordinated tactics. They are stronger than normal Agents. They are able to enhance their melee attacks with Arts damage, and employ a variety of techniques to break through unprepared defenders.
enemy_1049_eagent_2.ability: Temporarily reduces the maximum Block of targets attacked by this unit

enemy_1051_norwiz.name: Authorized Caster
enemy_1051_norwiz.description: A basic caster soldier. Arts have been one of the most threatening forms of warfare since ancient times, and a large amount of research has gone into adapting Arts for contemporary warfare.

enemy_1051_norwiz_2.name: Authorized Caster Leader
enemy_1051_norwiz_2.description: A basic caster soldier, more threatening than a normal Authorized Caster. Arts have been one of the most threatening forms of warfare since ancient times, and a large amount of research has gone into adapting Arts for contemporary warfare.

enemy_1052_noramr.name: Shielded Guard
enemy_1052_noramr.description: A standard melee-range soldier. Their lightweight riot shields provide them both offensive and defensive flexibility. In battle, they pose a substantial threat to our front lines.

enemy_1052_noramr_2.name: Shielded Guard Leader
enemy_1052_noramr_2.description: A standard melee-range soldier. They are more dangerous than normal Shielded Guards Their lightweight riot shields provide them both offensive and defensive flexibility. In battle, they pose a substantial threat to our front lines.

enemy_1053_norgst.name: Ergate
enemy_1053_norgst.description: An engineer that specializes in sabotage, almost never seen wielding weapons. Though unarmed, they utilize their agility and cunning to slip through defenses in order to sabotage mechanical and electrical equipment.

enemy_1053_norgst_2.name: Ergate Leader
enemy_1053_norgst_2.description: An engineer that specializes in sabotage, almost never seen wielding weapons. Though unarmed, they utilize their agility and cunning to slip through defenses in order to sabotage mechanical and electrical equipment. They are more difficult to deal with than normal Ergates.

enemy_1054_norshd.name: Heavy Defender Type-N
enemy_1054_norshd.description: A melee soldier. Equipped with a full set of heavy armor, these experienced soldiers are skilled at dealing with a wide variety of physical attacks. They are hard to take down and must be dealt with carefully.

enemy_1054_norshd_2.name: Heavy Defender Type-S
enemy_1054_norshd_2.description: A melee soldier. They are more dangerous than normal Heavy Defenders. Equipped with a full set of heavy armor, these experienced soldiers are skilled at dealing with a wide variety of physical attacks. They are hard to take down and must be dealt with carefully.

enemy_1055_ganman.name: Sicilian
enemy_1055_ganman.description: A basic melee combatant. These Siracusans adorn themselves with an ancient name, symbolizing the glory of an era bygone.

enemy_1055_ganman_2.name: Elite Sicilian
enemy_1055_ganman_2.description: A basic melee combatant with higher combat capabilities than a normal Sicilian. These Siracusans adorn themselves with an ancient name, symbolizing the glory of an era bygone.

enemy_1056_ganwar.name: Brawler
enemy_1056_ganwar.description: Combat personnel who have underwent special training. Their flurry of rapid blows are powerful enough to be fatal.

enemy_1056_ganwar_2.name: Elite Brawler
enemy_1056_ganwar_2.description: Exceptionally dangerous combatants who are even more destructive than normal Brawlers. Only the most heavily-armored Operators can withstand their blows.

enemy_1057_gansho.name: Marksman
enemy_1057_gansho.description: Tactical long-range combatants. Adept at oppressing enemies with continuous fire, their tactical literacy means they will prefer targeting our command terminal in order to cut off support.

enemy_1057_gansho_2.name: Elite Marksman
enemy_1057_gansho_2.description: Tactical long-range combatants, more dangerous than a normal Marksman. Adept at oppressing enemies with continuous fire, their tactical literacy means they will prefer targeting our command terminal in order to cut off support. Proceed with caution.

enemy_1058_traink.name: Bully
enemy_1058_traink.description: Special melee combatants. Their unstoppable bulk is equivalent to blocking three normal enemies, and Operators who cannot block three enemies may not be able to halt their advance at all.
enemy_1058_traink.ability: Can only be blocked by Operators with 3 or more Block

enemy_1058_traink_2.name: Bulldozer
enemy_1058_traink_2.description: Special melee combatants. Their unstoppable bulk is equivalent to blocking three normal enemies, and Operators who cannot block three enemies may not be able to halt their advance at all. Compared to a normal Bully, they boast greater attack power and armor.
enemy_1058_traink_2.ability: Can only be blocked by Operators with 3 or more Block

enemy_1059_buster.name: Fanatic
enemy_1059_buster.description: Special long-range combatants. Wielding a massive iron hammer, they boast enormous destructive potential and will targeted attacking facilities first. They can also hit Operators stationed on high ground.

enemy_1059_buster_2.name: Desperate Fanatic
enemy_1059_buster_2.description: Special long-range combatants, with greater combat capabilities than normal Fanatics. Wielding a massive iron hammer, they boast enormous destructive potential and will targeted attacking facilities first. They can also hit Operators stationed on high ground.

enemy_1060_emouse.name: Greytail
enemy_1060_emouse.description: A member of the Rat King's elite guard. The Rat King has bestowed upon them a special Originium Art that can be used for shielding. When the shield is broken, they will be more agile.
enemy_1060_emouse.ability: Greatly increased DEF when the shield is present; greatly increased movement speed after the shield is destroyed

enemy_1060_emouse_2.name: Greytail Leader
enemy_1060_emouse_2.description: A member of the Rat King's elite guard, boasting greater combat capabilities than normal Greytails. The Rat King has bestowed upon them a special Originium Art that can be used for shielding. When the shield is broken, they will be more agile.
enemy_1060_emouse_2.ability: Greatly increased DEF when the shield is present; greatly increased movement speed after the shield is destroyed

enemy_1061_zomshd.name: Possessed Heavy Defender
enemy_1061_zomshd.description: A heavy defender that has been controlled by an unknown entity, capable of regenerating rapidly. Well-protected by elite tactical gear, the appearance of such an aberration on the battlefield is almost beyond imagination.

enemy_1061_zomshd_2.name: Possessed Heavy Defender Leader
enemy_1061_zomshd_2.description: A heavy defender leader that has been controlled by an unknown entity, capable of regenerating rapidly. Well-protected by elite tactical gear, the appearance of such an aberration on the battlefield is almost beyond imagination.

enemy_1062_rager.name: Enraged Possessed Soldier
enemy_1062_rager.description: An enemy combatant who has slowly descended into primal madness as their lifeforce is consumed. The infection has penetrated their bone marrow, and they are unusually aggressive as a result. The appearance of such an aberration on the battlefield is almost beyond imagination.
enemy_1062_rager.ability: Will gradually lose HP over time

enemy_1062_rager_2.name: Enraged Possessed Leader
enemy_1062_rager_2.description: An enemy combatant who has completely given in to primal madness as their lifeforce is consumed. The infection has penetrated their bone marrow, and their death-defying aggression breaks the bounds of reason. The appearance of such an aberration on the battlefield is almost beyond imagination.
enemy_1062_rager_2.ability: Will gradually lose HP over time

enemy_1063_rageth.name: Enraged Possessed Thrower
enemy_1063_rageth.description: An enemy ranged combatant who has slowly descended into primal madness as their lifeforce is consumed. The infection has penetrated their bone marrow, and they will hurl whatever they can get their hands on at their targets. The appearance of such an aberration on the battlefield is almost beyond imagination.
enemy_1063_rageth.ability: Will gradually lose HP over time

enemy_1063_rageth_2.name: Enraged Possessed Bonethrower
enemy_1063_rageth_2.description: An enemy ranged combatant who has completely given in to primal madness as their lifeforce is consumed. The infection has penetrated their bone marrow, they will even rip out the Originium lodged inside their bodies to throw because of their deadened sense of pain. The appearance of such an aberration on the battlefield is almost beyond imagination.
enemy_1063_rageth_2.ability: Will gradually lose HP over time

enemy_1064_snsbr.name: Yeti Operative
enemy_1064_snsbr.description: A basic melee combatants of the Yeti Squadron hailing from teams of infected guerilla warriors in the Northwestern Tundra. They are skilled at attacking frozen Operators.
enemy_1064_snsbr.ability: Attack power increases when attacking <$ba.frozen>Frozen</> targets

enemy_1065_snwolf.name: Frostfang
enemy_1065_snwolf.description: Creatures manipulated by the Yeti Squadron. Their bodies are equipped with a certain brand of monitoring equipment. Due to their speed and natural camouflage in the tundra environment, they can easily slip through our defenses and inflict massive damage. At the same time, they can inflict fatal damage to frozen Operators, and must be dealt with cautiously.
enemy_1065_snwolf.ability: Attack power increases when attacking <$ba.frozen>Frozen</> targets

enemy_1065_snwolf_2.name: Razorfrost
enemy_1065_snwolf_2.description: Creatures manipulated by the Yeti Squadron, possessing higher combat capabilities than regular Frostfangs. Their bodies are equipped with a certain brand of monitoring equipment. Due to their speed and natural camouflage in the tundra environment, they can easily slip through our defenses and inflict massive damage. At the same time, they can inflict fatal damage to frozen Operators, and must be dealt with cautiously.
enemy_1065_snwolf_2.ability: Attack power increases when attacking <$ba.frozen>Frozen</> targets

enemy_1066_snbow.name: Yeti Sniper
enemy_1066_snbow.description: A basic ranged combatants of the Yeti Squadron hailing from teams of infected guerilla warriors in the Northwestern Tundra. Their synergy with other Yeti Squadron members make them pose an immense threat to frozen Operators.
enemy_1066_snbow.ability: Attack power increases when attacking <$ba.frozen>Frozen</> targets

enemy_1066_snbow_2.name: Yeti Sniper Leader
enemy_1066_snbow_2.description: Senior ranged combatants of the Yeti Squadron hailing from teams of infected guerilla warriors in the Northwestern Tundra. Their richer combat experience and synergy with other Yeti Squadron members make them pose an immense threat to frozen Operators.
enemy_1066_snbow_2.ability: Attack power increases when attacking <$ba.frozen>Frozen</> targets

enemy_1067_snslime.name: Infused Glacial Originium Slug
enemy_1067_snslime.description: An infected wild creature native to colder environments that has become unstable due to assimilating a large amount of Originium into its abdomen. Upon death, they will explode and freeze nearby Operators. Due to their low intelligence, they are easily controlled by Yeti Squadron members for various tactical purposes.
enemy_1067_snslime.ability: Upon death, deals Physical damage in an area and applies <$ba.cold>Cold</> to affected targets

enemy_1067_snslime_2.name: Infused Glacial Originium Slug α
enemy_1067_snslime_2.description: An infected wild creature native to colder environments that has become unstable due to assimilating a large amount of Originium into its abdomen. More threatening than normal Infused Glacial Originium Slugs, they explode upon death, damaging and freezing nearby Operators. Due to their low intelligence, they are easily controlled by Yeti Squadron members for various tactical purposes.
enemy_1067_snslime_2.ability: Upon death, deals Physical damage in an area and applies <$ba.cold>Cold</> to affected targets

enemy_1068_snmage.name: Yeti Caster
enemy_1068_snmage.description: A basic caster of the Yeti Squadron hailing from teams of infected guerilla warriors in the Northwestern Tundra. Through special Arts and devices, they can inflict Cold on our Operators, reducing their attack speed and making them vulnerable to being Frozen.
enemy_1068_snmage.ability: After two attacks, the next attack applies the <$ba.cold>Cold</> effect

enemy_1068_snmage_2.name: Yeti Caster Leader
enemy_1068_snmage_2.description: An elite caster of the Yeti Squadron hailing from teams of infected guerilla warriors in the Northwestern Tundra, boasting greater combat capabilities. Through special Arts and devices, they can inflict Cold on our Operators, reducing their attack speed and making them vulnerable to being Frozen.
enemy_1068_snmage_2.ability: After two attacks, the next attack applies the <$ba.cold>Cold</> effect

enemy_1069_icebrk.name: Yeti Icecleaver
enemy_1069_icebrk.description: A special melee combatant of the Yeti Squadron hailing from teams of infected gerilla warriors in the Northwestern Tundra. Grim reapers on the battlefield, they wield long katanas that can easily ravage frozen Operators, hence the nickname they've been given, 'Ice Cleaver.'
enemy_1069_icebrk.ability: Attack power increases greatly when attacking <$ba.frozen>Frozen</> targets

enemy_1069_icebrk_2.name: Yeti Icecleaver Leader
enemy_1069_icebrk_2.description: A special melee combatant of the Yeti Squadron hailing from teams of infected gerilla warriors in the Northwestern Tundra. Experienced executioners on the battlefield, they wield long katanas that can easily ravage frozen Operators, and their nickname, 'Ice Cleaver,' references their devastating blows that seem strong enough to split glaciers.
enemy_1069_icebrk_2.ability: Attack power increases greatly when attacking <$ba.frozen>Frozen</> targets

enemy_1070_iced.name: Oneiros
enemy_1070_iced.description: An unmanned, slow-flying enemy drone equipped with a special warhead released upon approaching Operators that inflicts Arts damage and a freezing effect in an area. Modified from the Bombtail, they lost their ability to accelerate after delivering the payload in order to accomodate a special warhead.
enemy_1070_iced.ability: Can launch a warhead to deal AoE Arts damage and apply the <$ba.cold>Cold</> effect to targets

enemy_1071_dftman.name: Sarkaz Swordsman
enemy_1071_dftman.description: A Sarkaz mercenary. Though scarred by years of war, they are still fighting to fulfill the orders of their employers.

enemy_1071_dftman_2.name: Sarkaz Blademaster
enemy_1071_dftman_2.description: A Sarkaz mercenary, more skilled than an ordinary Sarkaz Swordsman. Though scarred by years of war, they are still fighting to fulfill the orders of their employers.

enemy_1072_dlancer.name: Sarkaz Lancer
enemy_1072_dlancer.description: A Sarkaz mercenary. After special training, they are capable of rushing forward with a long spear, building up speed. The faster they charge, the harder they strike anyone who might stand in their way.
enemy_1072_dlancer.ability: Gradually accelerates when moving, and deals additional damage on the first attack after being blocked based upon Movement Speed.

enemy_1072_dlancer_2.name: Sarkaz Lancer Leader
enemy_1072_dlancer_2.description: A Sarkaz, more threatening than a normal Sarkaz Lancer. After special training, they are capable of rushing forward with a long spear, building up speed. The faster they charge, the harder they strike anyone who might stand in their way.
enemy_1072_dlancer_2.ability: Gradually accelerates when moving, and deals additional damage on the first attack after being blocked based upon Movement Speed.

enemy_1073_dscout.name: Sarkaz Sentinel
enemy_1073_dscout.description: A Sarkaz mercenary. They are responsible for scouting, patrolling, and issuing early warnings to the entire squad. Once attacked, the Herald will immediately issue a warning that Inspires the entire army, shifting allied Sarkaz on Standby into Combat-Ready mode.
enemy_1073_dscout.ability: When injured, issues an alarm to immediately enhance the ATK and DEF of all enemy units, and makes enemies in Standby immediately enter Combat-Ready mode.

enemy_1073_dscout_2.name: Sarkaz Sentinel Leader
enemy_1073_dscout_2.description: A seasoned Sarkaz mercenary who has been through many battles. They are responsible for scouting, patrolling, and issuing early warnings to the entire squad. Once attacked, the Herald will immediately issue a warning that Inspires the entire army, shifting allied Sarkaz on Standby into Combat-Ready mode.
enemy_1073_dscout_2.ability: When injured, issues an alarm to immediately enhance the ATK and DEF of all enemy units, and makes enemies in Standby immediately enter Combat-Ready mode.

enemy_1074_dbskar.name: Sarkaz Grudgebearer
enemy_1074_dbskar.description: A Sarkaz mercenary. Their Originium-wracked bodies have become convenient tools in their operations, allowing them to unleash Arts without relying on a staff. Though they won't attack while on Standby, they will cruelly expend their own life to complete their mission once in Combat-Ready mode.
enemy_1074_dbskar.ability: Starts battle in Standby and does not attack; After being injured, this unit becomes Combat-Ready and deals long-range Arts damage to two targets.

enemy_1074_dbskar_2.name: Sarkaz Worldcurser
enemy_1074_dbskar_2.description: An elite Sarkaz caster mercenary. Their Originium-wracked bodies have become convenient tools in their operations, and their accumulated resentment has crystallized into raw power. Though they won't attack while on Standby, they will cruelly expend their own life to complete their mission once in Combat-Ready mode.
enemy_1074_dbskar_2.ability: Starts battle in Standby and does not attack; After being injured, this unit becomes Combat-Ready and deals long-range Arts damage to two targets.

enemy_1075_dmgswd.name: Sarkaz Bladeweaver
enemy_1075_dmgswd.description: A Sarkaz mercenary. The Originium flowing through their blood allows them to hold these crudely modified Arts-imbued greatswords. Though they won't attack while on Standby, they are capable of dealing melee attacks that inflict Arts damage while in Combat-Ready mode.
enemy_1075_dmgswd.ability: Starts battle in Standby and does not attack; After being injured, this unit becomes Combat-Ready and deals melee Arts damage.

enemy_1075_dmgswd_2.name: Sarkaz Bladeweaver Leader
enemy_1075_dmgswd_2.description: An elite Sarkaz mercenary who has mastered the combination of swordsmanship and Arts. The Originium flowing through their blood allows them to hold these crudely modified Arts-imbued greatswords. Though they won't attack while on Standby, they are capable of dealing melee attacks that inflict Arts damage while in Combat-Ready mode.
enemy_1075_dmgswd_2.ability: Starts battle in Standby and does not attack; After being injured, this unit becomes Combat-Ready and deals melee Arts damage.

enemy_1076_bsthmr.name: Demolitionist
enemy_1076_bsthmr.description: A high-level elite Reunion combatant who wears heavy-duty, explosion-proof protective gear. Their special Originium-powered hammers have massive destructive range, and must be dealt with cautiously.
enemy_1076_bsthmr.ability: Attacks cause an explosion, dealing Splash damage to units around the primary target.

enemy_1076_bsthmr_2.name: Demolitionist Leader
enemy_1076_bsthmr_2.description: A high-level elite Reunion combatant who wears heavy-duty, explosion-proof protective gear, more aggressive than normal Demolitionists. Their special Originium-powered hammers have massive destructive range, and must be dealt with cautiously.
enemy_1076_bsthmr_2.ability: Attacks cause an explosion, dealing Splash damage to units around the primary target.

enemy_1077_sotihd.name: Guerrilla Hound
enemy_1077_sotihd.description: A basic warhound utilized by guerilla fighters. Sporting lightweight Ursus armor, they have a degree of defensive capabilities without sacrificing mobility.

enemy_1077_sotihd_2.name: Guerrilla Hound Pro
enemy_1077_sotihd_2.description: A better-trained warhound utilized by guerilla fighters. Sporting lightweight Ursus armor, they have a degree of defensive capabilities without sacrificing mobility, and are more aggressive than normal Guerilla Hounds.

enemy_1078_sotisc.name: Guerrilla Fighter
enemy_1078_sotisc.description: A basic guerilla fighter. After receiving tactical commands, they will gain increased capabilities and utilize a full range of offensive maneuvers.

enemy_1078_sotisc_2.name: Guerrilla Fighter Leader
enemy_1078_sotisc_2.description: A veteran guerilla fighter. After receiving tactical commands, they will gain increased capabilities and utilize a full range of offensive maneuvers.

enemy_1079_sotisp.name: Guerrilla Sniper
enemy_1079_sotisp.description: A basic guerilla sniper who has received professional, military-grade sharpshooting skills. After receiving tactical commands, they will gain increased capabilities and attack two targets at once.
enemy_1079_sotisp.ability: When Inspired, attacks one additional target.

enemy_1079_sotisp_2.name: Guerrilla Sniper Leader
enemy_1079_sotisp_2.description: A veteran guerilla sniper who has extensive professional, military-grade sharpshooting skills. After receiving tactical commands, they will gain increased capabilities and attack two targets at once.
enemy_1079_sotisp_2.ability: When Inspired, attacks one additional target.

enemy_1080_sotidp.name: Guerrilla Herald
enemy_1080_sotidp.description: Patriot's guerilla fighters employ a special language to communicate and synergize their coordinated operations on the battlefield. The heralds are important links within their communication system. While present, they will issue tactical commands to increase the offensive and defensive abilities of nearby allies.
enemy_1080_sotidp.ability: Increases the ATK and DEF of enemy units when on the battlefield.

enemy_1080_sotidp_2.name: Guerrilla Herald Leader
enemy_1080_sotidp_2.description: Compared to regular heralds, these leaders have greater individual combat capabilities. The heralds are important links within their communication system. While present, they will issue tactical commands to increase the offensive and defensive abilities of nearby allies.
enemy_1080_sotidp_2.ability: Increases the ATK and DEF of enemy units when on the battlefield.

enemy_1081_sotisd.name: Guerrilla Shieldguard
enemy_1081_sotisd.description: One of Patriot's elite defenders. Carrying out Patriot's will, these shieldguard form the solid foundation of the 'Aegis of the Infected.' Equipped with high-performance protective armor, they cover for their comrades by drawing fire from enemies while present on the battlefield.
enemy_1081_sotisd.ability: More likely to be targeted by attacks.

enemy_1081_sotisd_2.name: Guerrilla Shieldguard Leader
enemy_1081_sotisd_2.description: The cream of the crop among Patriot's elite defenders. After extensive training, the Shieldguard Leaders don heavier protective armor and cover for their comrades by drawing fire from enemies while present on the battlefield.
enemy_1081_sotisd_2.ability: More likely to be targeted by attacks.

enemy_1082_soticn.name: Guerrilla Mortar
enemy_1082_soticn.description: One of Patriot's elite suppression troops. Adept at long-ranged shelling, these fighters move more slowly because of their medium armor but also enjoy increased protection. After receiving tactical commands, they will gain greatly increased combat capabilities and have significantly increased attack speed.
enemy_1082_soticn.ability: When Inspired, gains greatly increased ASPD.

enemy_1082_soticn_2.name: Guerrilla Mortar Leader
enemy_1082_soticn_2.description: The cream of the crop among Patriot's elite suppression troops. Compared to ordinary mortars, these troops equip more dangerous and destructive shells. After receiving tactical commands, they will gain greatly increased combat capabilities and have significantly increased attack speed.
enemy_1082_soticn_2.ability: When Inspired, gains greatly increased ASPD.

enemy_1083_sotiab.name: Guerilla Siegebreaker
enemy_1083_sotiab.description: One of Patriot's elite assault fighters. These troops specialize in assaults and airborne operations into enemy backlines. They wear medium armor and boast very strong individual combat capabilities. After receiving tactical commands, they will gain greatly increased combat capabilities and have greatly increased attack power.
enemy_1083_sotiab.ability: When Inspired, gains greatly increased ATK.

enemy_1083_sotiab_2.name: Guerilla Siegebreaker Leader
enemy_1083_sotiab_2.description: The cream of the crop among Patriot's elite assault fighters. Though boasting greater individual combat capabilities than normal Siegebreakers, they often end up behind bars. After receiving tactical commands, they will gain greatly increased combat capabilities and have greatly increased attack power.
enemy_1083_sotiab_2.ability: When Inspired, gains massively increased ATK.

enemy_1084_sotidm.name: Sarkaz Guerrilla Fighter
enemy_1084_sotidm.description: A Sarkaz fighter who supports Patriot but cannot understand the special terminology of their guerilla operations. The Sarkaz ritual maintained by the Sarkaz Originium Altars will not damage them, instead strengthening their bodies and converting their attacks into Arts damage.
enemy_1084_sotidm.ability: When coming into contact with a Pulse Wave, this unit instead takes no damage and will deal Arts damage with normal attacks.

enemy_1084_sotidm_2.name: Sarkaz Guerrilla Fighter Leader
enemy_1084_sotidm_2.description: A Sarkaz fighter who boasts greater destructive power, but cannot understand the special terminology of their guerilla operations. The Sarkaz ritual maintained by the Sarkaz Originium Altars will not damage them, instead strengthening their bodies and converting their attacks into Arts damage.
enemy_1084_sotidm_2.ability: When coming into contact with a Pulse Wave, this unit instead takes no damage and will deal Arts damage with normal attacks.

enemy_1084_sotidm_3.name: Mercenary Sarkaz Fighter
enemy_1084_sotidm_3.description: A Sarkaz mercenary loyal to Talulah. The Sarkaz ritual maintained by the Sarkaz Originium Altars will not damage them, instead strengthening their bodies and converting their attacks into Arts damage.
enemy_1084_sotidm_3.ability: When coming into contact with a Pulse Wave, this unit instead takes no damage and will deal Arts damage with normal attacks.

enemy_1085_sotiwz.name: Sarkaz Guerrilla Caster
enemy_1085_sotiwz.description: A Sarkaz Caster who supports Patriot but cannot understand the special terminology of their guerilla operations. The Sarkaz ritual maintained by the Sarkaz Originium Altars will not damage them, instead strengthening their bodies and converting their attacks into Arts damage.
enemy_1085_sotiwz.ability: Does not attack; Casts Arts periodically, dealing Arts damage equivalent to ATK to all surrounding units. When coming into contact with a Pulse Wave, this unit instead takes no damage and gains increased Attack Range.

enemy_1085_sotiwz_2.name: Sarkaz Guerrilla Caster Leader
enemy_1085_sotiwz_2.description: A Sarkaz Caster who boasts greater destructive power, but cannot understand the special terminology of their guerilla operations. The Sarkaz ritual maintained by the Sarkaz Originium Altars will not damage them, instead strengthening their bodies and converting their attacks into Arts damage.
enemy_1085_sotiwz_2.ability: Does not attack; Casts Arts periodically, dealing Arts damage equivalent to ATK to all surrounding units. When coming into contact with a Pulse Wave, this unit instead takes no damage and gains increased Attack Range.

enemy_1085_sotiwz_3.name: Mercenary Sarkaz Caster Leader
enemy_1085_sotiwz_3.description: A Sarkaz Caster mercenary loyal to Talulah. The Sarkaz ritual maintained by the Sarkaz Originium Altars will not damage them, instead strengthening their bodies and converting their attacks into Arts damage.
enemy_1085_sotiwz_3.ability: Does not attack; Casts Arts periodically, dealing Arts damage equivalent to ATK to all surrounding units. When coming into contact with a Pulse Wave, this unit instead takes no damage and gains increased Attack Range.

enemy_1086_ltsodr.name: Leithanien Rebel
enemy_1086_ltsodr.description: One of Leithania's radicalized locals. The widespread popularity of classical Originium Arts has made them more threatening, and their attacks inflict Arts damage.

enemy_1086_ltsodr_2.name: Leithanien Rebel Leader
enemy_1086_ltsodr_2.description: One of Leithania's local militia leaders. The widespread popularity of classical Originium Arts has made them more threatening, and their attacks inflict Arts damage.

enemy_1087_ltwolf.name: Winterwisp Hound
enemy_1087_ltwolf.description: A hunting hound trained and utilized by locals since ancient times. For early aboriginals and pioneers, these hounds were considered invaluable partners.

enemy_1087_ltwolf_2.name: Winterwisp Hound Pro
enemy_1087_ltwolf_2.description: A pack leader trained and utilized by locals since ancient times. For early aboriginals and pioneers, these hounds were considered invaluable partners.

enemy_1088_ltsmer.name: Leithanien Whisperer
enemy_1088_ltsmer.description: An Arts user commonly seen throughout Leithania. They attack using Arts, and will cast on L-44 'Gramophones' within their attack range to attempt to seize control of them.
enemy_1088_ltsmer.ability: Continuously casts at the nearest non-enemy controlled 'Gramophone' within attack range to attempt to seize control of it.

enemy_1088_ltsmer_2.name: Leithanien Psalmist
enemy_1088_ltsmer_2.description: An experienced Leithanien combatant who utilizes Arts. Their Arts are more powerful, and they will cast on L-44 'Gramophones' within their attack range to attempt to seize control of them.
enemy_1088_ltsmer_2.ability: Continuously casts at the nearest non-enemy controlled 'Gramophone' within attack range to attempt to seize control of it.

enemy_1089_ltlntc.name: Winterwisp Blood Shaman
enemy_1089_ltlntc.description: Locals who have studied the ancient Arts of Winterwisp are much more terrifying than modern Casters. Their ancient sacrificial rituals are capable of instantly dealing area Arts damage, as well as severing Arts ley lines to seize control of L-44 'Gramophones.'
enemy_1089_ltlntc.ability: Gradually loses HP over time; Upon death, deals Arts damage to all surrounding units and immediately seizes control of any 'Gramophones.'

enemy_1089_ltlntc_2.name: Winterwisp Blood Magister
enemy_1089_ltlntc_2.description: A mixed-blood well-versed in Winterwisp's ancient Blood Arts, much more terrifying than modern Casters. Their ancient sacrificial rituals are capable of instantly dealing area Arts damage, as well as severing Arts ley lines to seize control of L-44 'Gramophones.'
enemy_1089_ltlntc_2.ability: Gradually loses HP over time; Upon death, deals massive Arts damage to all surrounding units and immediately seizes control of any 'Gramophones.'

enemy_1090_mdsnpr.name: Mudrock Matterllurgist
enemy_1090_mdsnpr.description: A member of Mudrock's Sarkaz squad. Integrating Sarkaz tactics with Leithanien Arts, they are capable of inflicting lethal damage with a block of energy, and prioritize attacking units closest to the contract entrance site.
enemy_1090_mdsnpr.ability: Prioritizes attacking units that are vying for control of a 'Gramophone.'

enemy_1090_mdsnpr_2.name: Mudrock Matterllurgist Leader
enemy_1090_mdsnpr_2.description: A member of Mudrock's Sarkaz squad. Integrating Sarkaz tactics with Leithanien Arts to greater effect, they are capable of inflicting lethal damage with a block of energy, and prioritize attacking units closest to the contract entrance site.
enemy_1090_mdsnpr_2.ability: Prioritizes attacking units that are vying for control of a 'Gramophone,' attacks two targets simultaneously.

enemy_1091_mdhmmr.name: Mudrock Zealot
enemy_1091_mdhmmr.description: A member of Mudrock's Sarkaz squad. The dance on the edge of life and death has given them a unique tactical system. Through Arts Resonance, they are able to create a barrier that absorbs Arts damage. While the barrier persists, they will have increased Max HP and ASPD.
enemy_1091_mdhmmr.ability: Has a barrier that absorbs Arts damage; While the barrier persists, this unit has greatly increased Max HP and ASPD.

enemy_1091_mdhmmr_2.name: Mudrock Zealot Leader
enemy_1091_mdhmmr_2.description: An elite of Mudrock's Sarkaz squad. The dance on the edge of life and death has given them a unique tactical system. Through Arts Resonance, they are able to create a barrier that absorbs Arts damage. While the barrier persists, they will have increased Max HP and ASPD.
enemy_1091_mdhmmr_2.ability: Has a barrier that absorbs Arts damage; While the barrier persists, this unit has greatly increased Max HP and ASPD.

enemy_1092_mdgint.name: Mudrock Colossus
enemy_1092_mdgint.description: This Originium construct, crafted by Mudrock, does not possess sentience and must be directly controlled by Mudrock. Though bulky and slow, they are extremely durable and boast terrifying physical damage and survivability.

enemy_1092_mdgint_2.name: Hexed Colossus
enemy_1092_mdgint_2.description: This Originium construct, crafted by Mudrock, has been entwined with ancient Sarkaz witchcraft and now serves as an extension of its owner's will. The principle behind this Originium Art is quite obscure, but these constructs undoubtedly boast greater survivability and destructive power than normal Colossi.

enemy_1093_ccsbr.name: Tiacauh Warrior
enemy_1093_ccsbr.description: One of Acahualla's most commonly-seen warriors who uses a crude spear to attack. May pose unexpected difficulties if fighting at close range.

enemy_1093_ccsbr_2.name: Tiacauh Guard
enemy_1093_ccsbr_2.description: A braver, fiercer warrior who uses a crude spear to attack. Years of training have given these warriors tough physiques, and they fear not even the fiercest attacks.

enemy_1094_ccspm.name: Tiacauh Lancer
enemy_1094_ccspm.description: Not much different from a regular warrior, except they've learned to throw their spears. Though their range is limited, they get the job done.

enemy_1094_ccspm_2.name: Tiacauh Sniper
enemy_1094_ccspm_2.description: Warriors who have gained greater proficiency in using thrown weapons due to training, and boast greater lethality. However, due to the weight of their weapons, their range hasn't really improved.

enemy_1095_ccripr.name: Tiacauh Fanatic
enemy_1095_ccripr.description: A fervent Tiacauh warrior with very fast attack speed. Though each strike is not particularly powerful, those caught off guard will be quickly subdued by a rain of blows.
enemy_1095_ccripr.ability: Every attack reduces the enemy's DEF

enemy_1095_ccripr_2.name: Tiacauh Ripper
enemy_1095_ccripr_2.description: An extremely fervent Tiacauh warrior with very fast attack speed. Each strike now deals noteworthy damage, and those caught off guard will be quickly subdued by a rain of blows.
enemy_1095_ccripr_2.ability: Every attack reduces the enemy's DEF

enemy_1096_ccwitch.name: Tiacauh Ritualist
enemy_1096_ccwitch.description: The very few Originium Arts users in Acahualla will often serve as doctors for their tribe. Despite not developing their Originium Arts, their medical experience lets them strike where it hurts.
enemy_1096_ccwitch.ability: Gains DEF when blocked, and deals Physical damage with melee attacks.

enemy_1096_ccwitch_2.name: Tiacauh Shaman
enemy_1096_ccwitch_2.description: These extremely rare Arts users from Acahualla have a deeper understanding of Originium Arts. With more threatening Arts in their arsenal and years of medical experience, they are a force to be reckoned with if allowed to approach up-close.
enemy_1096_ccwitch_2.ability: Gains DEF when blocked, and deals Physical damage with melee attacks.

enemy_1097_cclmbjk.name: Tiacauh Shredder
enemy_1097_cclmbjk.description: One of Zumama's chosen elites, bestowed with excellent equipment. In addition to being potent in combat, they have the ability to destroy terrain in order to seize the advantage. Those who seek to use long-range attacks against them will have to diversify their tactics.
enemy_1097_cclmbjk.ability: After several attacks, destroys Giant Mushrooms and Stumps, rendering them unable to be deployed upon.

enemy_1097_cclmbjk_2.name: Tiacauh Annihilator
enemy_1097_cclmbjk_2.description: One of Zumama's chosen elites, bestowed with superlative equipment. In addition to being potent in combat, they have the ability to destroy terrain in order to seize the advantage. Those who seek to use long-range attacks against them will have to diversify their tactics.
enemy_1097_cclmbjk_2.ability: After several attacks, destroys Giant Mushrooms and Stumps, rendering them unable to be deployed upon.

enemy_1098_cchmpn.name: Tiacauh Brave
enemy_1098_cchmpn.description: A very formidable Tiacauh warrior, naturally born to do battle. These warriors harbor great pride in their combat abilities, and live for the thrill of the duel no matter where they are. Their single-mindedness allows them to shrug off all outside interference.
enemy_1098_cchmpn.ability: When blocked, this unit will only receive damage from the unit blocking it, and the DEF of both units is decreased.

enemy_1098_cchmpn_2.name: Tiacauh Champion
enemy_1098_cchmpn_2.description: An incredibly formidable Tiacauh warrior, with the qualifications to become a Warchief. These warriors harbor great pride in their combat abilities, and live for the thrill of the duel no matter where they are. Their single-mindedness allows them to shrug off all outside interference.
enemy_1098_cchmpn_2.ability: When blocked, this unit will only receive damage from the unit blocking it, and the DEF of both units is decreased.

enemy_1099_nbkght.name: Nameless Independent Knight
enemy_1099_nbkght.description: An independent Kazimierz knight. A low profile and unrefined skill means this one will soon be swept away in the tide of knight competition.

enemy_1099_nbkght_2.name: Nameless Elite Knight
enemy_1099_nbkght_2.description: An independent Kazimierz knight with some degree of achievement, though not enough to inspire any confidence. Sooner or later, they'll probably get swallowed up by the competition.

enemy_1100_scorpn.name: Training Pincerbeast
enemy_1100_scorpn.description: Infected creatures commonly found in the great lakes and rivers of Kazimierz, captured and raised by casters and used as tools to train knights and entertain fight spectators.

enemy_1100_scorpn_2.name: Vicious Training Pincerbeast
enemy_1100_scorpn_2.description: Infected creatures commonly found in the great lakes and rivers of Kazimierz, these male pincerbeasts are fed special hormones and made more aggressive than the regular ones. They're a cruel tool to train knights and entertain fight spectators.

enemy_1101_plkght.name: Roar Knightclub Trainee
enemy_1101_plkght.description: Wearing the high-performance, lightweight armor provided by Roar Guards, this new batch of experimental armor has some humorous deficiencies that made these people into pitiful test subjects. 'Roar Guards, even the winds will bow to you!'
enemy_1101_plkght.ability: Starts with significantly increased DEF and RES, persists for a period.

enemy_1101_plkght_2.name: Roar Knightclub Elite
enemy_1101_plkght_2.description: Wearing the high-performance, lightweight armor provided by Roar Guards, this new batch of experimental armor has some humorous deficiencies, and even though these are battle-hardened knights, they have still been reduced to pitiful test subjects. 'Roar Guards, even the winds will bow to you!'
enemy_1101_plkght_2.ability: Starts with significantly increased DEF and RES, persists for a period.

enemy_1101_plkght_3.name: 'Plastic' Szewczyk
enemy_1101_plkght_3.description: The first member of Roar Knightclub's Majors team, now representative of Roar Arena: Tough armor, defensive counterattack, a hundred thousand fans, worth a million! Don't forget! 'Roar Guards, even the winds will bow to you!'
enemy_1101_plkght_3.ability: Starts with significantly increased DEF and RES, persists for a long period.

enemy_1102_sdkght.name: Independent Knight Shielder
enemy_1102_sdkght.description: An independent Kazimierz knight. In the ever-changing competition circuit, relying on defense to steadily rack up points is an effective strategy.

enemy_1102_sdkght_2.name: Elite Knight Shielder
enemy_1102_sdkght_2.description: An independent Kazimierz knight, with more expensive equipment, on the verge of finding a sponsor. In the ever-changing competition circuit, relying on defense to steadily rack up points is an effective strategy.

enemy_1103_wdkght.name: Bloodboil Knightclub Trainee
enemy_1103_wdkght.description: A trainee from the Bloodboil Knightclub. The Bloodboil Knights have long been known for their ferocity and aggression, from trainees to knight nobles. Whenever one of their brothers falls, they gain courage and combat prowess.
enemy_1103_wdkght.ability: ATK and ASPD increase with each enemy death, up to 10 times.

enemy_1103_wdkght_2.name: Bloodboil Knightclub Elite
enemy_1103_wdkght_2.description: A regular knight from the Bloodboil Knightclub. The Bloodboil Knights have long been known for their ferocity and aggression, from trainees to knight nobles. Whenever one of their brothers falls, they gain courage and combat prowess.
enemy_1103_wdkght_2.ability: ATK and ASPD increase with each enemy death, up to 10 times.

enemy_1103_wdkght_3.name: 'Brassrust' Olmer Ingra
enemy_1103_wdkght_3.description: The great knight known as the 'Butcher of the Field'! Convicted several times for acts of brutality, avoided trial several times thanks to corporate contributions! Youngest son of the Ingra family, an ancient knightly lineage! A ruthless fighter who gets stronger with each battle! Olmerrrrrr Ingraaaaaaa!
enemy_1103_wdkght_3.ability: ATK and ASPD increase with each enemy death, up to 10 times.

enemy_1104_lfkght.name: Bladehelm Knightclub Trainee
enemy_1104_lfkght.description: A trainee from the Bladehelm Knightclub. This order of young competition knights chose the name of the ancient heroes of Kazimierz. In fact, they exhibit only arrogance and complacency from that extinct lineage. They are good at picking fights and don't go down easily.
enemy_1104_lfkght.ability: Significantly decreases ATK of the unit with the highest ATK for a period.

enemy_1104_lfkght_2.name: Bladehelm Knightclub Elite
enemy_1104_lfkght_2.description: A regular knight from the Bladehelm Knightclub. This order of young competition knights chose the name of the ancient heroes of Kazimierz. In fact, they exhibit only arrogance and complacency from that extinct lineage. They are good at picking fights and don't go down easily.
enemy_1104_lfkght_2.ability: Significantly decreases ATK of the unit with the highest ATK for a period.

enemy_1104_lfkght_3.name: 'Left-handed' Tytus Topopla
enemy_1104_lfkght_3.description: His nose is high as the sun, and he's almost as terrifyingly strong, if much, much colder. And look how many fans have lined up for him! He's 'Left-handed' Tytus Topola! He weakens his enemies' resolve, crushes their spirit, sneering down at them as they fall to their knees in surrender. That's a Left-handed victory!
enemy_1104_lfkght_3.ability: Significantly decreases ATK of the unit with the highest ATK for a period.

enemy_1105_tyokai.name: Sponsor Drone
enemy_1105_tyokai.description: Ellen Select Technology thanks you for your sponsorship! This quick and affordable drone carries the passion of the fans, bringing anything to the knights on the field: traps, explosives, medicine, or even snacks! The outcome of the battle is in your hands!
enemy_1105_tyokai.ability: When destroyed, grants a deployable unit; Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter.

enemy_1105_tyokai_2.name: Luxury Sponsor Drone
enemy_1105_tyokai_2.description: Ellen Select Technology thanks you for your generous sponsorship! This heavy and luxurious drone carries the passion of the fans, bringing anything to the knights on the field: devices, fishing rods, or carbonated beverages! The outcome of the battle is in your hands!
enemy_1105_tyokai_2.ability: When destroyed, grants a large number of deployable units; Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter.

enemy_1106_byokai.name: Cheering Sponsor Drone
enemy_1106_byokai.description: Ellen Select Technology thanks you for your heartfelt sponsorship! This drone broadcasts select commercials from the General Chamber of Commerce to knights and spectators at all times, stimulating the crowd and making the competition that much more exciting!
enemy_1106_byokai.ability: When destroyed, greatly increases the ASPD and DEF of your deployed units for a certain period; Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter.

enemy_1107_uoffcr.name: Infected Patrol Captain
enemy_1107_uoffcr.description: An officer tasked with hunting the Infected of Ursus. Greedy and cold-blooded.
enemy_1107_uoffcr.ability: Can use long-ranged weapons to attack Ursus Civilians and Talulah, the Fighter.

enemy_1107_uoffcr_2.name: Elite Infected Patrol Captain
enemy_1107_uoffcr_2.description: A high-ranking officer tasked with hunting the Infected of Ursus. Greedy and cold-blooded. They are not a part of the army, and are generally despised by Ursus soldiers and city officials alike.
enemy_1107_uoffcr_2.ability: Can use long-ranged weapons to attack Ursus Civilians and Talulah, the Fighter.

enemy_1108_uterer.name: Ursus Mangler
enemy_1108_uterer.description: A warbeast trained by the Ursus Army. Obedient and relentless, they tear through armor with ease to sate their thirst for flesh and blood.

enemy_1108_uterer_2.name: Ursus Mangler Packmother
enemy_1108_uterer_2.description: A warbeast pack leader trained by the Ursus Army. Obedient and relentless, they tear through armor with ease to sate their thirst for flesh and blood. Nobody has ever seen a male mangler.

enemy_1109_uabone.name: Ursus Assault Crossbowman
enemy_1109_uabone.description: An Ursus soldier who is proficient at infiltrating deep into enemy territory. Equipped with a powerful heavy-duty crossbow.

enemy_1109_uabone_2.name: Elite Ursus Assault Crossbowman
enemy_1109_uabone_2.description: An Ursus soldier who is exceptionally proficient at infiltrating deep into enemy territory. Equipped with an extremely powerful heavy-duty crossbow.

enemy_1110_uamord.name: Ursus Armored Caster
enemy_1110_uamord.description: A basic caster in the Ursus Army. Clad in simple armor.

enemy_1110_uamord_2.name: Elite Ursus Armored Caster
enemy_1110_uamord_2.description: A basic caster in the Ursus Army who has displayed excellence. They are clad in armor and wield more powerful Arts.

enemy_1111_ucommd.name: Ursus Raider
enemy_1111_ucommd.description: Special forces within the Ursus Army that strike a balance between mobility and breakthrough capabilities. Good at fighting underequipped enemy forces.
enemy_1111_ucommd.ability: Can only be blocked by units with at least 2 Block; Can use long-ranged weapons to attack Ursus Civilians and Talulah, the Fighter.

enemy_1111_ucommd_2.name: Ursus Raider Leader
enemy_1111_ucommd_2.description: Captains within the Ursus Army that strike a balance between mobility and breakthrough capabilities, equipped with higher-quality armor. Good at fighting underequipped enemy forces.
enemy_1111_ucommd_2.ability: Can only be blocked by units with at least 2 Block; Can use long-ranged weapons to attack Ursus Civilians and Talulah, the Fighter.

enemy_1112_emppnt.name: Imperial Artillery Targeteer
enemy_1112_emppnt.description: A heavily-armored, sturdily-built drone operated by artillery casters of the Ursus army. They presage the withering firepower of the Ursus Artillery.

enemy_1112_emppnt_2.name: Imperial Artillery Core Targeteer
enemy_1112_emppnt_2.description: A heavily-armored, sturdily-built core drone operated by artillery technicians of the Ursus army. They presage the withering firepower of the Ursus Artillery.  The Ursus Artillery is a fire team that has bunkered down into the city. Though packing less firepower than naval guns, their equipment still shreds through buildings and armor with ease.

enemy_1113_empace.name: Imperial Striker
enemy_1113_empace.description: The powerful infantry of the Ursus Army, the backbone of the Imperial Army's aggressive advance. They are versatile in offense and defense, melee and ranged. After sustain a certain amount of damage, their morale will peak, causing them to inflict more destruction.
enemy_1113_empace.ability: Uses ranged attacks when not blocked; gains greatly increased ATK when HP drops under half.

enemy_1113_empace_2.name: Elite Imperial Striker
enemy_1113_empace_2.description: The powerful, battle-tested infantry of the Ursus Army, the backbone of the Imperial Army's aggressive advance. They are versatile in offense and defense, melee and ranged. After sustain a certain amount of damage, their morale will peak, causing them to inflict more destruction. Along with the Shieldguards, they formed the front line of the Ursus Army.
